groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Internal Transformation Program

RealTimeOS Enterprise Build Plan

This section defines how New Era implements RealTimeOS for itself. Every artifact is a deliverable that must emit facts. Strategy, SOWs, Mini-OS systems, genies, streams, QMS assets, and operating cadences all enter one executable plan.

Core rule: if a deliverable does not create traceable lifecycle facts, it is still an idea. The plan runs on fact evidence, not narrative status updates.

groups.label: Program Scope
groups.html:
Scope Unit

One internal program covering all RealTimeOS assets, not client projects.

Execution Unit

Deliverables grouped by domain and workstream, tracked through one lifecycle model.

Control Unit

Facts drive Project Health. Workforce Maturity remains a separate outcome metric.

Output Unit

Build guides are generated from completed deliverable facts, then improved each sprint.

groups.label: Program Workstreams
groups.html:
WorkstreamMandateLeadPrimary Deliverables
WS-01 Strategy OperationalizationTurn strategic framework into executable initiatives and measurable outcomesMD + Strategy LeadInitiatives, KPI cadences, governance events
WS-02 Mini-OS BuildoutDefine and build Systems, Genies, and Streams for each internal domainPlatform LeadMini-OS assets, test packs, go-live records
WS-03 QMS and ControlsEmbed ISO process requirements into operational execution factsQMS LeadTemplates, review packs, NCR and CAPA loops
WS-04 Agentic Delivery EngineAutomate planning, tracking, review, and opportunity detectionAutomation LeadAdvisor flows, rule engines, tracker automations

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Canonical Inventory

Deliverable Canon

Every RealTimeOS artifact is normalized into one deliverable registry. This removes placeholder drift and creates one build queue across strategy, platform, and operations.

groups.label: Deliverable Types
groups.html:
TypeID PatternExamplesRequired Evidence
Strategic InitiativeINIT-###Flywheel milestone, Workforce Maturity target plan, operating cadenceHypothesis, owner, KPI definition, baseline fact
SOW / Commercial PackageSOW-###Internal package model, outcome bonus structure, scope constraintsApproved terms, pricing logic, control gates
Mini-OS SystemSYS-{OS}-###Ops Intake, Finance Ledger Sync, HR Case ControlSchema, interfaces, test results
GenieGEN-{OS}-###Exception Classifier, Eligibility Checker, Dispatch EnginePrompt/config, tests, fail-mode behavior
StreamSTR-{OS}-###Weekly Ops Review, Month-End Close, Incident EscalationOrchestration map, handoff contracts, SLA tests
QMS ArtifactQMS-###Project Health review pack, audit checklist, lesson capture formTemplate version, clause mapping, approval record

Planning rule: all items currently marked as placeholder or idea must be created in this register with an owner and next required fact.

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Execution Engine

Mandatory Fact Lifecycle

One lifecycle works for all deliverable types. This keeps planning simple and lets advisors generate status directly from facts.

PHASE 01
DELIVERABLE_DEFINED
Item exists with owner, type, and purpose.
PHASE 02
SCOPED
Acceptance criteria and dependencies documented.
PHASE 03
DESIGN_APPROVED
Architecture and controls approved.
PHASE 04
BUILD_COMPLETED
Implementation complete and packaged.
PHASE 05
TEST_PASSED
Functional and control tests passed.
PHASE 06
LIVE_ACTIVATED
Running in operations with monitoring.
PHASE 07
VALUE_VERIFIED
Outcome evidence captured and reviewed.

groups.label: Fact Payload Standard
groups.html:
FieldRequirementExample
fact_typeOne canonical lifecycle eventTEST_PASSED
deliverable_idMust resolve to deliverable register rowGEN-OPS-003
ownerAccountable lead at event timeplatform.lead
evidence_linkRequired for all phases from DESIGN_APPROVED onwarddocs/tests/gen-ops-003-report.md
event_tsUTC timestamp from source system2026-02-19T14:22:00Z
statusPASS / FAIL / BLOCKEDPASS

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Plan Generation

Complete RealTimeOS Build Plan

The plan is generated by listing all deliverables and sequencing them through lifecycle facts. This creates a practical backlog that can be executed by humans and agents.

groups.label: 12-Week Trial Roadmap
groups.html:
SprintPrimary GoalFact Exit CriteriaOutput
Weeks 1-2Build complete deliverable register and owners100% of current artifacts emit DELIVERABLE_DEFINEDCanonical inventory, no orphan placeholders
Weeks 3-4Scope and design top-priority internal Mini-OS itemsTop 25 items emit SCOPED and DESIGN_APPROVEDExecutable build queue
Weeks 5-8Build and test highest-value Systems, Genies, StreamsTop 15 items emit BUILD_COMPLETED and TEST_PASSEDPilot operating capability
Weeks 9-10Activate live flows and review controlsPilot items emit LIVE_ACTIVATEDLive internal RealTimeOS loop
Weeks 11-12Verify value and publish build guide updatesPilot items emit VALUE_VERIFIEDEvidence-backed guide revisions

groups.label: Project Health Gates
groups.html:
Gate Completion
40%
Percent of planned facts completed on time
Schedule Reliability
25%
Missed dates and queue churn
Blocker Age
20%
Aging blocked items over 7 days
Stale Fact Risk
15%
No lifecycle events in expected cadence

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Operationalization Pattern

Strategy to Facts Mapping

This is how strategic framework content becomes executable project work. Each strategic statement is converted into initiatives, deliverables, and measurable facts.

groups.label: Example Mapping
groups.html:
Strategic StatementInitiativeDeliverablesRequired Facts
Reach 40% Workforce MaturityINIT-001 Workforce Shift ProgramSYS-OPS-001, GEN-OPS-003, STR-OPS-002BASELINE_CAPTURED, LIVE_ACTIVATED, VALUE_VERIFIED
Compounding flywheel disciplineINIT-002 Lesson-to-Build LoopQMS-014 lesson pack, STR-PLT-004 review streamREVIEW_COMPLETED, SYSTEM_OPPORTUNITY_RAISED, BUILD_STARTED
Agentic delivery as default modeINIT-003 Internal Advisor PipelineGEN-PLT-011 planner, GEN-PLT-012 reviewerTEST_PASSED, LIVE_ACTIVATED, WEEKLY_SUMMARY_PUBLISHED

Simplicity rule: strategic items are not tracked separately from delivery. They are tracked through the same deliverable and fact model.

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Template Pattern

Reuse EMS Build Guide Structure

EMS remains the format example. This section applies the same pattern to the full RealTimeOS internal program: staged build, test gates, evidence links, and rollout checkpoints.

groups.label: Reuse Rules
groups.html:
• Use the EMS staged guide shape for each deliverable family: System, Genie, Stream, Initiative, QMS artifact.
  • Each guide includes prerequisites, step-by-step build tasks, test gate, go-live gate, and value verification gate.
  • Guide progress is never manual status text only; it is driven by lifecycle facts from Section 06 tracking.
  • Completed guides become templates for future clients after internal proof is captured.

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Portfolio Audit

Section-by-Section Sweep Register

This register tracks real implementation status for every playbook section. Each missing item is a deliverable and must enter the fact lifecycle.

Execution rule: no section can be labeled complete if any critical platform or operating component is still idea-only, placeholder-only, or missing required facts.

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Operating Model

4-Person Delivery System

This is the practical execution system for a four-person team. It keeps work simple: one queue, one lifecycle, one weekly rhythm, agent-assisted planning.

groups.label: Role Split
groups.html:
RolePrimary AccountabilityDaily FocusNon-Negotiable Output
Clyde (CEO)Executive owner of all business operations, delivery, and final decisionsDrive day-to-day execution across strategy, delivery, operations, and prioritiesExecutive approvals, gate sign-off facts, and cross-section execution decisions
Matt Sampias (Director, Australia)Board-level strategic and finance governanceSupport high-level strategic direction, board decisions, and finance oversight; not in day-to-day operationsBoard strategy decisions and finance governance facts
Angel Garcia (Senior Engineer)Systems, Genies, Streams implementationBuild, test, deploy, capture evidence linksBUILD_COMPLETED and TEST_PASSED facts
Nigella Mosende (Care Team Lead)QMS, care team, templates, communicationsCare team playbooks, email templates, review packs, controlsQMS artifacts and VALUE_VERIFIED facts

groups.label: Weekly Cadence
groups.html:
DayRitualAgent SupportFact Output
MondayPlan from lifecycle gapsPlanner agent drafts sprint queueDELIVERABLE_SCOPED
Tuesday-WednesdayBuild and test blocksBuilder advisor suggests next implementation stepsBUILD_COMPLETED / TEST_PASSED
ThursdayControls and documentation passReviewer agent flags missing evidenceDESIGN_APPROVED / REVIEW_COMPLETED
FridayProject Health and opportunity reviewTracking agent posts gaps to RealTimeOS trackingPROJECT_HEALTH_REVIEW_COMPLETED

groups.label: Priority Deliverables to Seed Now
groups.html:
• Business Central foundation setup and integration blueprint.
  • Contact Center architecture and first operational stream.
  • Productivity OS personal workspace setup guide and baseline facts.
  • Strategic mantras as operational rules with weekly measurement.
  • Care team operating model, escalation playbook, and quality checks.
  • Email template library for delivery updates, incidents, reviews, and closures.

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Execution Backlog

Master Deliverable Register Seed

Initial seeded register to start execution now. Every row is a deliverable with one next lifecycle fact. Current owner is Clyde (CEO) across the register; assignment is delegated by you as work moves.

How to use: start each weekly planning session by moving highest-priority rows to their next fact. Do not add new work without owner and next-fact assignment. Agents should propose sequencing, drafts, and edits; final action is approved by Clyde (CEO).

Total: 0 Completed: 0 Open: 0
Master Register Burndown 0%
RealTimeOS Phase Burndown (Phase 1-4 + Dashboard) 0%

groups.label: Section Delivery Rule
groups.html:
SectionMinimum DeliverablesBuild Guide RequirementAgent Automation Requirement
Each section (01-13)At least one initiative + one system/genie/stream + one control artifactEach deliverable must have a step-by-step build guide with gatesAgent drafts steps, QA checks consistency, and posts updates to tracking automatically
Infrastructure and Execution sectionsMultiple technical deliverables expected (not single rows)Guides must include environment setup, testing, and go-live checksAgent runbooks generate checklists and flag missing prerequisites
QMS and Delivery sectionsTemplate packs and operating procedures as deliverablesGuides must include owner handoffs and review cadenceAgent validates template completeness and clause mappings

groups.label: Overview
groups.html:
Quality Execution

RealTimeOS Content Review Queue

All playbook content is reviewed with one action model: Pass, Edit, Delete, or Agent. This turns document cleanup into a managed delivery stream with clear ownership.

Decision model: each reviewed item must end in exactly one state. No undecided rows are allowed after review sessions.

Content Groups Total: 0 Groups Reviewed: 0 Groups Remaining: 0
Content Review Burndown (Sections + Tabs + Groups) 0%
Phase Targets: 5 Phase Complete: 0 Phase Remaining: 5
RealTimeOS Phase Burndown (Phase 1-4 + Dashboard) 0%

groups.label: Action Definitions
groups.html:
ActionUse WhenOwnerRequired Fact
PASSContent is accurate, aligned, and usable as-is after quick polish checkReviewer of recordCONTENT_REVIEW_PASSED
EDITCore idea is right but wording, structure, evidence, or polish needs correctionAssigned editorCONTENT_EDIT_COMPLETED
DELETEContent is duplicate, obsolete, or misleadingSection ownerCONTENT_DELETED_APPROVED
AGENTAgent should rewrite, normalize, summarize, expand, or polish using defined promptAgent operator + approverAGENT_REVISION_COMPLETED

groups.label: Agent Execution Contract
groups.html:
FieldRuleExample
agent_task_idMandatory when action = AGENTAGREV-003
prompt_scopeMust define exact file + section scope04-minios.html Tab Productivity OS only
acceptance_criteriaMust define pass conditions before runNo placeholders, includes setup steps, includes fact fields
human_approverRequired before mergeClyde (CEO)
result_actionFinal state after review of agent outputPASS or EDIT

groups.label: Content Assistant Workflow
groups.html:
StepActionOutput
1Assistant reads one section only (starting with REV-001), tab by tab, group by groupStructured review notes per group
2Clyde (CEO) and assistant review correctness and polish wording/structure for clarityPolished content draft + PASS / EDIT / DELETE / AGENT decision
3Assistant runs fact-test on the reviewed groupFACT or NON-FACT classification
4If FACT, assistant creates candidate deliverable row for Master Register SeedSeed candidate with next fact and status
5Assistant updates burndown counts for section and moves to next groupLive completion progress per tab and section

groups.label: Fact Test Rule
groups.html:
TestQuestionIf YesIf No
Evidence TestCan this be evidenced, observed, or measured in operation?Candidate FACTNarrative only
Action TestDoes it require build/setup/operational action?Create deliverable candidateKeep as guidance text
Ownership TestCan Clyde assign a clear owner and next lifecycle fact?Add to Seed tabReturn for clarification
